intro: Cotula ebracteolata, commonly known as the common cotula, is a small, annual herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from spring to summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Cotula ebracteolata is noted for its rapid growth and is sometimes used in herbal medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
